00008 rn_link *
00009 ip_route(rn_machine * me, rn_message * msg)
00010 {
00011         int      i;
00012         int      sz;
00013 
00014         sz = g_ip_rt[msg->src][0];
00015 
00016         for(i = 1; i < sz; i++)
00017                 if(g_ip_rt[msg->src][i] == me->id)
00018                         return rn_getlink(me, g_ip_rt[msg->src][++i]);
00019 
00020         return NULL;
00021 }

00023 int
00024 routing_read()
00025 {
00026         int      src;
00027         int      dst;
00028         int      cnt;
00029 
00030         int      next;
00031         int      i;
00032 
00033         char     dir[1024];
00034 
00035         sprintf(dir, "tools/%s/ip.rt", g_rn_tools_dir);
00036         g_ip_routing_file = fopen(dir, "r");
00037 
00038         if(!g_ip_routing_file)
00039                 return 0;
00040 
00041 #if IP_RT_DEBUG
00042         printf("\nReading IPv4 routing table file: %s\n", dir);
00043 #endif
00044 
00045         g_ip_rt = tw_calloc(TW_LOC, "", sizeof(int *), g_rn_nmachines);
00046 
00047         next = 0;
00048         while(EOF != fscanf(g_ip_routing_file, "%d %d %d", &src, &dst, &cnt))
00049         {
00050                 if(0 == cnt)
00051                         continue;
00052 
00053                 if(g_ip_rt[src])
00054                         tw_error(TW_LOC, "Already allocated FT for %d (%d) \n", src, dst);
00055 
00056                 g_ip_rt[src] = tw_calloc(TW_LOC, "", sizeof(int), cnt+1);
00057                 g_ip_rt[src][0] = cnt;
00058 
00059                 for(i = 1; i <= cnt; i++)
00060                         fscanf(g_ip_routing_file, "%d", &g_ip_rt[src][i]);
00061 
00062                 next++;
00063         }
00064 
00065         fclose(g_ip_routing_file);
00066 
00067 #if IP_RT_DEBUG
00068         printf("\n\t%-50s %11d \n", "Forwarding tables", next);
00069 #endif
00070 
00071         return 1;
00072 }
00073 
00074 void
00075 routing_write()
00076 {
00077         rn_machine      *m;
00078 
00079         float            good;
00080         float            bad;
00081 
00082         int              i;
00083 
00084         char             dir[255];
00085 
00086         sprintf(dir, "tools/%s/ip.rt", g_rn_tools_dir);
00087         g_ip_routing_file = fopen(dir, "w");
00088 
00089         if(!g_ip_routing_file)
00090                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "Unable to create routing table file: %s", dir);
00091 
00092         if(tw_ismaster())
00093                 printf("Creating routing table file: %s\n", dir);
00094 
00095         bad = good = 0;
00096         for(i = 0, m = g_rn_machines; i < g_rn_nmachines; m = rn_getmachine(++i))
00097         {
00098                 switch(routing_init_ft_write(m))
00099                 {
00100                         case -1:
00101                                 break;
00102                         case 0:
00103                                 bad++;
00104                                 break;
00105                         default:
00106                                 good++;
00107                 }
00108         }
00109 
00110         fclose(g_ip_routing_file);
00111 
00112         printf("\t%-50s %11.0f \n", "Good Connections", good);
00113         printf("\t%-50s %11.0f \n", "Bad Connections", bad);
00114         printf("\t%-50s %11.4f \n", "Percent", bad / good);
00115 
00116         routing_read();
00117 }
00118 
00119 /*
00120  * Create global structures needed to read/write forwarding tables
00121  * Note: still sequential at this point, called from ip_main
00122  */
00123 void
00124 ip_routing_init()
00125 {
00126         if(!routing_read())
00127                 routing_write();
00128 }
00129 
00130 void
00131 routing_init_ft_read(ip_state * state, tw_lp * lp)
00132 {
00133         rn_machine      *m = rn_getmachine(lp->id);
00134 
00135 #if IP_RT_BINARY
00136         read(fileno(g_ip_routing_file), m->ft, m->subnet->area->g_ospf_nlsa * sizeof(short));
00137 #else
00138         fpos_t           pos;
00139 
00140         tw_lpid          id;
00141 
00142         int              i;
00143 
00144         if(m->type == c_host)
00145                 return;
00146 
00147         fgetpos(g_ip_routing_file, &pos);
00148         fscanf(g_ip_routing_file, "%lld", &id);
00149 
00150         if(id != lp->id)
00151         {
00152                 fsetpos(g_ip_routing_file, &pos);
00153                 return;
00154 
00155                 tw_error(TW_LOC, "No forwarding table for node: %ld", lp->id);
00156         }
00157 
00158         for(i = 0; i < m->subnet->area->g_ospf_nlsa; i++)
00159                 fscanf(g_ip_routing_file, "%d", &m->ft[i]);
00160 #endif
00161 }
00162 
00163         /*
00164          * frontier[] - stores the index to vertices that are in the frontier. 
00165          * solution[] - boolean solution set array. 
00166          *
00167          * d[] - distance to vertices. 
00168          * p[] - position of vertices in frontier[] array. 
00169          * f[] - boolean frontier set array. 
00170          */
00171 int     *frontier;
00172 int     *solution;
00173 int     *previous;
00174 
00175 unsigned int    *distance;
00176 
00177 int
00178 routing_init_ft_write(rn_machine * m)
00179 {
00180         rn_machine      *node;
00181         rn_link         *l;
00182 
00183         int              i, q, u, v;
00184         int              size;
00185         int              dist;
00186         int              last;
00187 
00188         if(-1 == m->conn)
00189                 return -1;
00190 
00191         if(!frontier)
00192         {
00193                 frontier = tw_calloc(TW_LOC, "", sizeof(int), g_rn_nmachines);
00194                 solution = tw_calloc(TW_LOC, "", sizeof(int), g_rn_nmachines);
00195                 previous = tw_calloc(TW_LOC, "", sizeof(int), g_rn_nmachines);
00196                 distance = tw_calloc(TW_LOC, "", sizeof(int), g_rn_nmachines);
00197         }
00198 
00199 #if VERIFY_ROUTING || 1
00200         if(m->id % 1000 == 0)
00201                 printf("\n%lld: Building path routing table \n", m->id);
00202 #endif
00203 
00204         for (i = 0; i < g_rn_nmachines; i++)
00205         {
00206                 previous[i] = -1;
00207                 frontier[i] = -1;
00208                 solution[i] = 0;
00209                 distance[i] = -1;
00210         }
00211 
00212         // The start vertex is part of the solutions set. 
00213         solution[m->id] = 1;
00214         frontier[0] = m->id;
00215 
00216         size = 1;
00217 
00218         // At this point we are assuming that all vertices are reachable from
00219         // the starting vertex and N > 1 so that j > 0.
00220         while(size)
00221         {
00222                 // Find the vertex in frontier that has minimum distance. 
00223                 for(q = 0, u = frontier[q], last = q; q < size; q++)
00224                 {
00225                         if(distance[frontier[q]] < distance[u])
00226                         {
00227                                 u = frontier[q];
00228                                 last = q;
00229                         }
00230                 }
00231 
00232                 if(--size)
00233                         frontier[last] = frontier[size];
00234 
00235                 dist = distance[u] + 1;
00236 
00237                 if(u == m->conn)
00238                         break;
00239 
00240                 solution[u] = 1;
00241                 node = rn_getmachine(u);
00242 
00243                 for(q = 0, l = node->link; q < node->nlinks; l = &node->link[++q])
00244                 {
00245                         if(l->wire->type == c_host && l->addr != m->conn)
00246                                 continue;
00247 
00248                         v = l->addr;
00249 
00250                         if(solution[v])
00251                                 continue;
00252 
00253                         if(dist > g_rn_ttl)
00254                                 break;
00255 
00256                         if(dist < distance[v])
00257                         {
00258                                 previous[v] = u;
00259                                 distance[v] = dist;
00260 
00261                                 frontier[size++] = v;
00262                         }
00263                 }
00264         }
00265 
00266         fprintf(g_ip_routing_file, "%lld %lld %d ", m->id, m->conn, dist-1);
00267 
00268         //if(distance[m->conn] <= g_rn_ttl)
00269         {
00270                 v = 0;
00271                 i = dist-2;
00272                 u = previous[m->conn];
00273                 //printf("\n%lld %lld: ", m->id, m->conn);
00274                 while(-1 != previous[u])
00275                 {
00276                         //printf("\t%d %d \n", i, u);
00277                         solution[i--] = u;
00278                         u = previous[u];
00279                         v++;
00280                 }
00281         }
00282 
00283         for(i = 0; i < v; i++)
00284                 fprintf(g_ip_routing_file, "%d ", solution[i]);
00285         fprintf(g_ip_routing_file, "\n");
00286 
00287         return dist;
00288 }

00291 /*
00292  * Construct the forwarding table for this simple ip router
00293  * Note: parallel at this point, called from ip_init
00294  *       (not going to be able to read/write in this context)
00295  */
00296 void
00297 ip_routing_init_ft(ip_state * state, tw_lp * lp)
00298 {
00299         char     dir[255];
00300 
00301         if(g_ip_write)
00302         {
00303                 if(!lp->pe->debugfd)
00304                 {
00305                         sprintf(dir, "%s/ip-%d-%d.rt", 
00306                                 g_rn_logs_dir, tw_net_mynode(), lp->pe->id);
00307 
00308                         lp->pe->debugfd = fopen(dir, "w");
00309 
00310                         if(!lp->pe->debugfd)
00311                                 tw_error(TW_LOC, 
00312                                          "Unable to create routing table file: %s", dir);
00313 
00314                         g_ip_write = 1;
00315                         printf("Creating routing table file: %s\n", dir);
00316                 }
00317 
00318                 routing_init_ft_write(state, lp);
00319         } else
00320                 routing_init_ft_read(state, lp);
00321 }
00322 #endif
